translated: Melin, Ragnar August, county forest inspector, Visby, b. 19/12/82 in Visby to district treasurer Oskar M. and Hermanna Lindström. Married 14/xx to Ulila Malmiström. Children: Bertil b. 15, Elisabeth b. 17, Björn b. 18. — Completed Latin exams in 1901, science exams in 1902, forestry exams from the Forestry Institute in 1905. Became a forest inspector in the Norrk district in 1906, assistant in Jämtland in 1906, Burträsk Hunting District in 1906, Vargiså Hunting District in 1907, county forest inspector in Gotland in 1908. Chief of the national fuel committee from 1917-1919, member of the county board's forestry advisory board since 1927, chairman of the board for the state firewood control in Gotland from 1939-1940, board member and executive director of the board for the Liljevalchs Forestry Fund since 1931, county forest fire chief from 1940-1946, chairman of the Visby city planting committee from 1933-1945, board member of the girls' school since 1934, Mayflower committee member since 1917, member of the city council from 1941-1946, member of the treasury chamber since 1926, vice chairman since 1940, lay judge, chairman of the DBV society in 1926, vice chairman of the tree board since 1932, board member of the DBV Savings Bank since 1943, chairman of the Visby hunting society since 1946, member of the Gotland sharpshooter and hunter guilds from 1937-1945, board member of the Mayflower National Association Central Committee since 1936, Swedish Hunters Association since 1939, board member of the retirement home board in Visby since 1942, board member of the Swedish fire-fighting association, Gotland division, Visby Tennis Club since 1919, auditor of the A-B Gotland Bank. Writings: About farming and pastureland in Gotland (1923), chapter about Gotland in Sweden as a forestry country (1937), The Gotland Forest (The Book about Gotland 1945), articles in professional journals, and more. Holder of the Order of the North Star, Royal Order of Vasa, Shooting Grand Master, Swedish Hunters Association honorary gold medal.
